course.subject: CIVL
course.name: Geotechnical Earthquake Engineering and Soil Dynamics
course.description: Earthquakes and characterization of ground motions, seismicity assessment, soil dynamics and site response analysis, soil liquefaction assessment and post-liquefaction analysis, seismic analysis of slopes and embankments, lateral earth pressures and retaining systems, dynamic soil-structure interaction.

reviews.author: HKUST-1
reviews.title: 唔差的geo pg course 雖然我唔知自己學咗啲咩
reviews.comment_content:
內容包啲咩我直接copy個syllabus入面就算
啲notes全部都係王剛自己整 好王剛style

Lecture 1: Introduction to Seismic Hazard

Seismic wave; earthquake parameters; probabilistic seismic hazard analysis (PSHA); seismic design code

Lecture 2:  Ground Motion Characterization

Ground motion characteristics; Response spectrum; ground motion attenuation; ground-motion prediction equations for spectral accelerations; near-source ground motions; ground motion variability

Lecture 3: Site Response Analysis (I)

Dynamics of a single DOF system; wave propagation in elastic medium; vertically propagated horizontal shear waves; uniform undamped soil on rigid rock; uniform damped soil on rigid rock; layered soils on elastic rock; site response analysis

Lecture 4: Site Response Analysis (II)

Dynamic soil properties; dynamic shear moduli and damping of sands, clays and gravels; one-dimensional ground response analysis; local site effects

Lecture 5: Soil Liquefaction

Liquefaction hazards; cyclic soil behaviors; empirical methods for liquefaction triggering; consequence of liquefaction; mitigation of liquefaction hazards

Lecture 6: Seismic Slope Stability and Deformation Analysis

Dynamic resistance of slopes; pseudo-static slope stability analysis; dynamic response characteristics of sliding masses; seismically induced permanent slope displacement

Lecture 7: Seismic Design of Retaining Structures

Types of retaining wall; static and dynamic earth pressures on retaining walls

Lecture 8. Dynamic Soil Structure Interaction

SSI effects; bearing strength of shallow foundation; SSI for pile foundation; advanced computational models; piles in liquefiable soils

你問我學咗啲咩嘅話
我會話你知我學咗earthquake嘅mechanism，點樣去define個earthquake有幾勁，點樣度earthquake，有咩方法用地震源附近嘅data去計其他地方食到嘅earthquake，咩係dynamic liquefaction，dynamic liquefaction FOS計法，seismic slope stability，點樣計地震導致嘅slope displacement，retaining structure嘅design，

overall嚟講我會話得個知字，我知呢啲咩嚟，我知點樣計，但係我真係唔知點解係咁計，同埋我淨係識sub式計

呢個course我最大嘅收獲係我學式咗用matlab，有一份功課要我地用matlab去將啲data用fourier transformation去拆啲acceleration定係唔知咩出嚟，而唔改code係乜都做唔到嘅
我問professor係咪要自己改matlab啲code去做呢份功課，professor話

"What is the difficulty?"

結果我喺computer barn坐咗幾日9-5，就係去學matlab點樣出我想要嘅data，同埋我要用佢俾嘅software去gen啲data俾matlab plot

除咗我可以好肯定咁話你知我學識用matlab之外，我真係唔敢打包單咁講我明佢做緊乜
reviews.comment_teaching:
王剛style
睇得ust space又想讀5字頭geo course嘅話一定讀過4700同4760架啦
唔講太多
你知我知單眼佬都知
問咩佢都會答

3個鐘lecture，中間10分鐘break，有時佢會買罐汽水 或者出去煲煙再翻嚟
reviews.comment_grading:
2份homework 1份take home final

homework要做幾日
final我做咗1個禮拜
上網唔會搵到答案
最後A-
professor冇講啲分點派
reviews.comment_workload:
得asm 同take home final
不過真係做得有啲耐
一份都要幾日 所以呢度俾個B

reviews.author: yabayaba123
reviews.title: Fair enough class
reviews.comment_content: The class covers earthquake engineering, soil dynamics, liquefaction analysis, seismic hazard analysis, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: He was okay. Sometimes, the lectures are boring. But the professor is very knowledgeable in mathematics and earthquake engineering. He is also always available to answer questions and replies quickly. I just think that some lessons weren't expounded as much as I wanted them to be.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was fine. The professor didn't give feedback on our work, so I had no idea how my grade came about by the end of the semester. I got an A or A-, I forgot.
reviews.comment_workload:
The requirements are three homework and one take-home final exam. Almost all homework involves programming and a lot of calculations. Professor gives a lot of hints for the homework, even including the slide numbers where we can get the answer from.

The final exam was also long, but good thing that the exam was kind of similar to the homework, so even though it was long, it was also just okay.

If I remember correctly, he also asked the class if we wanted either a project or an exam.
